alert.note: Alert for Golden Valley (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued June 07 at 11:02AM MDT until further notice by NWS Billings
info.description: ...The Flood Watch continues for the following rivers in Montana... Musselshell River near Lavina affecting Golden Valley County. .The Musselshell River at Shawmut has fallen more than half a foot since yesterday and upstream decreases at Harlowton indicate the immediate flood potential has diminished such that the Flood Watch for the stretch of the Musselshell River near Shawmut can be cancelled. The Musselshell River downstream at Lavina remains near flood stage this morning, and runoff from last nights heavy rains in northern Stillwater county or additional heavy rainfall through tonight may be enough to push this location over flood stage in the next 24 hours. Thus the flood watch will continue for the Lavina stretch of the Musselshell River. ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Flooding is possible. * WHERE...Musselshell River near Lavina. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...Flooding of low lying areas along the river is possible. Significant erosion is likely at flows of this magnitude, and may result in damage of infrastructure along the river as well as land loss. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:30 AM MDT Wednesday the stage was 9.2 feet. - The river has remained steady just below flood stage over the past 24 hours. Upstream drops in the rivers level should result in decreased flows over the next 24 hours. However runoff from recent heavy rainfall over northern Stillwater county may hold flows up, thus the flood watch will continue until sustained drops in the rivers flow are observed. - Forecast...Flood stage may be reached based on the latest forecast information. - Flood stage is 9.5 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (12 pm) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Thu Fri Sat Musselshell River Lavina 9.5 9.3 Wed 10 am 8.7 8.4 8.1 &&
info.instruction: Residents and those with interests near the river should monitor rising water levels and be prepared for possible flood warnings. Do not enter or cross flowing water or water of unknown depth. Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe. Please report observed flooding to local emergency officials and request they pass the information to the National Weather Service in Billings. Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information. The latest stages and forecasts for rivers and streams can be found at our web page: https://water.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued no later than Thursday morning by 1115 AM MDT.
